message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for(int i=0; i<original.size(); i++){
    for(int j=i+1; j<original.size(); ){
        if(original.get(i).equals(original.get(j))){
            original.remove(j);
        } else {
            j++;
        }
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The issue with your code is that when you remove an element from the ArrayList, the size of the ArrayList decreases by 1. This means that the index of the next element to be compared also decreases by 1. By using a while loop and not incrementing j when a duplicate is found, you ensure that the next element to be compared is the same index as the one that was just removed.
